@tmf_mike Yeah, I think I jumped ship about 20 eps in. Felt he was just trying to cover far too much in the allotted time.
@tmf_mike Yeah, sounds about right. Fairly short-burst episodes around the 10-15 minute mark?
@tmf_mike Covering the entire history was too ambitious for the podcast I listened to. Better to have given focus to a single figure/event.
@tmf_mike I tried a Rome podcast a few years back. Lost me a few episodes in as there were far too many figures and events to keep up with.
@tmf_mike I tried non-fiction and found it heavy going. Got a John Le Carré book lined up to see how it fares fiction-wise.
@tmf_mike I'll have to give Audible another try. Wasn't sold on my first experience but suspect it was due to subject matter and narrator.
@tmf_mike Absolutely right! Got books on Mexican drug cartels, political figures, etc, all half-read because the narrative was poorly told.
@tmf_mike It's reminding me that reading doesn't have to feel like a chore (sorry Uncle Ho).
@tmf_mike Enjoying it so far. First time in a long time I've read two fiction books in succession. Feeling like I need the escapism.
@tmf_mike 11.22.63. Holding off on Dark Tower after (hopefully) finishing this one fairly quickly.
Coffee + Stephen King book. Sunday morning set.
Picnic at Hanging Rock was cool. Read like a high school English text, only without the teacher making you finish a chapter every night.
